developerResponse: {'id': 19445164, 'body': 'Thank you so much for your kind words. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us!\n', 'modified': '2020-11-30T18:14:22Z'}
review: I personally believe that everything you see , hear, read, watch, listen too. Everything you take in is what you will put out. So by these positive affirmations which is the only thing I allow to notify me on my phone , when they pop up. It‚Äôs like a breath of fresh air. Nothing changes over night, but I have been looking this stuff up and reading into it for a while. Positive affirmations can change the way you think. Even if you think you can‚Äôt, just continue reading them and hearing them for a month . Watch how your life can change. We all should strive to be more positive human beings. I know it can be hard, especially since I come from a very abusive and violent back ground. You can change your negative thinking habits. I challenge you to trying positive affirmations for a month and to also be monitoring your thoughts...also called mental chatter. Try to calm your mind and always be in the present moment , and if you‚Äôre going to have thoughts. Do your best to always make them positive. Positive affirmations is one of the ways to help with this. I also learn from our teacher Jesus Christ. A lot to learn from the good Book. The Holy Bible. Guys try it and see. I wish everyone to find their purpose in life and to be more loving and show more compassion towards one another. May God bless you all. Sending positive vibes!‚úùÔ∏èü§ç
title: Felecia‚Äôs view on this

review:
I‚Äôve tried several mood tracking apps over the years. I feel like they help in the beginning to identify what is happening, but over time it just felt like a regular reminder that I was down and at a certain point that stops being helpful. I‚Äôm not severely depressed  - just another person struggling with the roller coaster of life over the last few years. We own a stressful business, separated from my wife, then later found out I had cancer. Therapy helps a bunch, but when my therapist took a break for maternity leave I was on my own and needed some help. 

I decided to try this app instead of another mood tracker, and I am so glad I did. I can customize the categories of affirmations I receive and how often they pop up. I can‚Äôt begin to describe how helpful it is to have some positive words show up on my Apple Watch just when I needed it. If I had one suggestion for the developers it would be to create a category specific to cancer patients. Most of the messages are great, but having incurable cancer means my health is literally failing so messages that remind me that I should be grateful for my health are not negative, but also not necessarily helpful. Otherwise this a great app. Very easy to set up and I hope it helps you as much as it‚Äôs helped me so far‚Ä¶
title: Try it

developerResponse: {'id': 36686461, 'body': 'Wow, thanks for the great review! It means so much to us. We appreciate you!\n', 'modified': '2023-05-23T14:22:35Z'}
review: I have tried several personal growth, meditation, and inspiration apps. This is by far the best and the only one that stuck with my for more than a week. I rarely pay for the years subscription for anything but this made a difference in my life and my days and the way that it customized to your needs like how many days you would like positive reminders or affirmation and at what points of the day you may need them most. The chime for the alert when a positive message comes in is like ‚Äúcalm technology‚Äù it‚Äôs a sweet peaceful chime that you learn to recognize and instead of being another overwhelming alert text or marketing thing you feel a sense of comfort and joy when that sound come it. It reminds you to be more present in the moment and your day. So many time a message came in with just the right thing that I needed to read at a moment I truly needed it. Even my daughter recognizes the positive sound and how it uplifts me to receive them. I highly recommend this to anyone but especially to those with any PTSD, chronic pain, anxiety, depression. It makes a difference. At least it does for me.
title: A little edge on your best life

developerResponse: {'id': 19863753, 'body': 'We are so grateful for your kind words. Thanks for sharing your experience with us and the community.\n', 'modified': '2020-12-19T00:00:17Z'}
review: My cousin asked for my phone one day, and as I handed it to her, I said, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt set no GPS up on there...I know how nosy you are‚Äù. I was teasing, but an applicable truth. See, I am going thru depression right now. Facing some long standing truths in an effort to save my children from my own childhood trauma. It‚Äôs a struggle worth seeing thru the storms, but sometimes I get super discouraged. My cousin, knowing how weak I feel and how my circumstances effect my outcome, is ACTUALLY nosy...AND LOVING and CARES, so she would very much GPS my phone, coming from that space. But about an hour after she had my phone, I got a very appropriate and reassuring message from ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and I just stared at it for a while. It brought me to tears once I realized how it got there. I‚Äôm managing my struggle right now. This app has given me certain constant reminders and reinforcements,  that I may isolate from in the physical sense. I appreciate my cousin for downloading this app. I need it and she cares enough to make sure, I got it. Even in her own struggles, she can‚Äôt always be there for me, but she made sure she did what she could...and to know I mattered, really does matter to me. So ‚ÄúThank you‚Äù to ‚ÄúI am‚Äù for being a positive piece to my process.
title: Constant reminders needed

review: I‚Äôve struggled with my body image for many a years but this app, this honestly helped way more than I think anything else could. This is such a good app imo, even though honestly this sounds like an ad (ü•≤üò≠üíÄ) this is honestly an amazing app to me, it works well, has a cute aesthetic, cute idea and such sweet messages. You‚Äôre eyes are glowing today and that outfit, it‚Äôs just stunning. You‚Äôre stunning!! Have a blessed day and thank you so much for this beautiful app. <3 May the lord bless you all :)!

I would be thinking something so negative and damaging every day and these affirmations keep fighting my negative thoughts and helping me break the cycle. The more I got interrupted with a positive thought, the more I questioned why I believed such horrible negative ‚Äútruths‚Äù about myself and others and became more compassionate and loving to myself and those around me. I notice and am receptive to more positive things in life and as a result more positive things happen to me. This app is worth every penny. It is the reason I am less depressed and my brain is slowly shifting cognitively to be more positive...because why not? Why don‚Äôt we believe that we are worthy and beautiful and that life is beautiful? You can only enjoy life if you choose to enjoy what is in front of you and be thankful. I am so thankful for this app and for the creators. This is beautifully done and very effective. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: My Review ü§ó

developerResponse: {'id': 35061295, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve our app, so we really appreciate it. We‚Äôll pass this along to our development team!\n', 'modified': '2023-02-24T19:40:32Z'}
review:
Anyone who says this app isn‚Äôt littered with toxic positivity (and ableist prompts) sadly is unable to recognize it when they see them. I constantly get prompts that start with ‚ÄúI choose __‚Äù (like I choose to be happy, I choose to be calm, etc). Apparently my depression, anxiety, and PTSD can be cured by just choosing something else! Who knew! ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I wish I could remember where I was saving all the screenshots of the bad ones bc there‚Äôs also been ones along the lines of ‚Äúmy body is healthy‚Äù or ‚ÄúI will exercise everyday‚Äù and the like. Uh, I‚Äôm disabled with multiple chronic illnesses. My body is not healthy, nor will I perform to the extent it thinks I should. The app was somewhat okay when I first got it a year or so ago, but it‚Äôs just getting worse and worse, and sends the same prompts with slightly different wording all the time. It also doesn‚Äôt seem to learn to stop sending similarly-themed ones you don‚Äôt like after lots of downvoting either (otherwise I would‚Äôve stopped getting a ton of the toxic positivity and ableist ones). 

So do yourself a favor. If you have chronic illnesses or mental health disorders, you‚Äôre probs going to want to steer clear of this app so you don‚Äôt get triggered or irritated just about every time the notification pops up. I‚Äôm glad I finally deleted this app so I won‚Äôt have to see the nonsense anymore.
title: Toxic positivity galore

developerResponse: {'id': 35574177, 'body': "We're sorry to see you go, but we appreciate your feedback. ", 'modified': '2023-03-24T17:21:25Z'}
review: They‚Äôre going to type a generic ‚Äúapp costs money to make‚Äù response‚Ä¶Yeah we know! It‚Äôs not about that. It‚Äôs that you download based on something and they keep changing it until you lose all the features. Now there are barely ANY unlocked affirmations left. Why would I waste storage on that when I can pay for another app that‚Äôs actually honest and consistent doesn‚Äôt the start?‚Ä¶I used to love this app, especially the widget function UNTIL suddenly my ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù affirmations were no longer showing up on rotation. This had happened before so I assumed it was another tech glitch (you can set a customizable widget but are unable to actually set it to that. So you have to always keep the affirmations manually set to the type you want). However this time I realized it wasn‚Äôt showing my favorite affirmations (that I had spent months selecting) because all of them had been added to the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù locked categories. Before only a few categories were locked. Now ALL except 3 are available. That means unless you‚Äôre paying this app money every month, you‚Äôve now lost access to all your previously curated affirmations. Once I figured that out, it was an easy decision to delete the widget *and* the app itself.
title: Used to be great but GREEDINESS made me delete.

review:
So I been pretty depressed and in absolute pain recently, mainly that I have terrible teachers and only one class with ‚Äúa friend‚Äù and scoliosis and other problems. This does not work how you expect do you think just some random motivational quotes will make you happier then the rabbit in Looney Tunes that always gets in trouble? No it doesn‚Äôt and for me it actually kind of made it worse because I some reason personally gets mad at inanimate objects all the time, literally every day I probably throw something like a pen across the room. And it just made it worse, this review might not be going anywhere but this definitely makes a huge note to people if people look at the reviews on this app. If you have depression or just down recently, probably go to a gym punch a bag or a therapist. Depends on your age but that‚Äôs pretty much helps most people tbh, it sounds like any other movie or show when a dude is mad at a heartbreak and feels better when he‚Äôs in a boxing ring, or someone lost a job and went to a therapist. But it‚Äôs true it does help to beat something.

Overall the app does nothing I only rated 2 stars because the aesthetic, but it‚Äôs annoying with the ringtones and it just gets me mad even more.
title: Terrible, except for the aesthetic of the messages and widgets.

title: Positive thinking booster

developerResponse: {'id': 23796703, 'body': 'Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this amazing review!', 'modified': '2021-07-07T10:41:03Z'}
review: As a clinician that assist in the overcoming of trauma and various other mental health hurdles, I highly recommend this app. The fact that it helps myself and my clients isn‚Äôt what I want you to look at for this review. I want you to take this challenge! Download the app, set aside 5mins, and focus on your breathing. When you are nice and ready, start the practice affirmations (little play button on the bottom) and I want you to go through each one and own it; like for 5mins I want you to act as if every I am statement every positive affirmation came from you that part that wants to be whole and free. I mean I am not promising you that you will grow abs or win a million dollars. And if you don‚Äôt feel grounded and positive, then delete the app and be on your way. I mean it‚Äôs simply just taking time to show up for yourself. This app just makes it more convenient. So alright go ahead, take the challenge, and maybe just maybe you will be better for it. From your friendly neighborhood. LCPC.
title: Clinician Recommended

developerResponse: {'id': 35715389, 'body': 'Thanks so much for sharing your positive experience with our app. We‚Äôre so glad you‚Äôre enjoying it! \n', 'modified': '2023-04-01T19:38:01Z'}
review: I love this app because in a world that can be so cruel and ugly, I can set myself reminders of positive sayings, thoughts, quotes, that keep my mind in check that I can be positive no matter what. Whatever else is going on, the most important thing is to remember to love and take care of myself, and just with the business and everyday tasks of life I can forget that. This app will let you just get a few reminders to a lot of reminders. I personally like a lot so I make sure I‚Äôm  always getting those powerful positive messages that remind me I am an awesome person, even with things I need to work on. I have anxiety and some depression and this really helps me get through some of that as well! I just really think this app could help so many people because we tend to forget about ourselves and put our kids, significant others, family and friends first, but we can‚Äôt truly take care of our loved ones unless we take care of ourselves first.
title: The real reminders I need to tell myself

review: I used to enjoy this app. I was able to create a few of my own positive affirmations that several people enjoyed. I decided to ditch the IPhone for a while and went back to my beloved Galaxy and forgot about the app. Long story short, I have returned to the sheep herding IPhone but also rediscovered I AM ‚Ä¶ now I can‚Äôt create anything. I have watched enough ad videos for a lifetime membership at this point however I will not pay. Mental Awareness Month and I am struggling with every aspect of my life. My depression and anxiety are at an all time high and I‚Äôm not new at this game (I‚Äôm 51 so I know a thing or two). I know one of my greatest stressors is due to my illness and inability to work. Can I justify paying for an app to help me when I can‚Äôt figure out how I was able to before I had to pay? Sure I can, but not while looking at my daughter‚Äôs shoes and knowing my priority is to help her depression and anxiety by helping her not worry about shoes ‚Ä¶ so that both of us and hopefully neither of us fall into the abyss of suicidal ideation. I will miss this app, but it won‚Äôt kill me. I‚Äôll probably die tripping on a Lego.
title: Maybe I‚Äôm just tired

developerResponse: {'id': 16818124, 'body': 'Please contact us at monkeytaps@gmail.com so we can assist you better.', 'modified': '2020-07-22T22:15:57Z'}
review:
I think it‚Äôs amazing that there‚Äôs an app that can send you positive affirmations daily or however many times a day you desire. For my own use, I have the app send me one reminder daily at 9am, so I can use that affirmation throughout the day (focus of the day). The only issue I have is, say, if I open the app directly from my phone without clicking the notification with my daily affirmation, it displays a different affirmation altogether. So then instead of seeing the same one that I was notified about, I‚Äôll see a new one. Perhaps I‚Äôm not navigating the app correctly, but when I flip up and down on the affirmations, I don‚Äôt see the one that I was notified with. I try to be intentional about clicking on the app aka avoiding it and just focusing on the alert notification, however, sometimes I forget, and then it‚Äôs kind of a bummer. 

On another positive note, I do really appreciate the wording of the affirmations being written in a positive context rather than a negative one.
title: Healing Reminders

developerResponse: {'id': 32961965, 'body': "We're glad our app has been able to lift your spirits. Is there something we can do to get 5 stars? Please let us know at hello@monkeytaps.app.", 'modified': '2022-11-03T22:15:31Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm in the midst of a divorce. The relationship has been both physically and emotionally emotionally abusive. I have been quite depressed and working hard to boost myself back up. I downloaded the app on a whim and I didn‚Äôt expect much. The Lock Screen notifications and widgets have truly lifted my day sometimes. 

I put a big widget on my main page of apps   I thought the messages would be corny. However they have been uplifting in a way I didn‚Äôt expect.   Seeing those positive statements after so many years of negative feedback is helping me. I read the messages that tell me I am worthy of happiness and peace and it nearly brings me to tears. 

I want to rate this app five stars. I‚Äôm only holding back because a lot of the affirmations were written by the same person and they didn‚Äôt have much depth. I also had a hard time figuring out the widgets. However the quality of the affirmations has improved. It is making me feel better and reclaim my value as a person. and
title: Surprisingly Improves My Day

review: This app is ok. It‚Äôs good, but there are some things that can be improved. For example, the affirmations. One of the affirmations said ‚ÄúI am a magnet for money.‚Äù Another said ‚ÄúI am sexy and attractive.‚Äù One said ‚ÄúI am thankful for the comfort and joy that money provides me.‚Äù Another said ‚ÄúI treat myself like I am my biggest fan.‚Äù Ok. First, what is up with the money stuff? This seems like a Buddhist app and if y‚Äôall are Buddhist you should believe in the Four Noble Truths. (They explain how wanting things like money leads to suffering.) Not very Buddhist of y‚Äôall to put those affirmations ü§®. Also, I know this is a positive affirmation app, but this is going a little too far. I am sexy and attractive? I treat myself like I am my biggest fan? This app is suppose to rise your self-esteem, but not make you too confident like you are the best person in the world! What about being humble and kind? Despite the bad things, though, it‚Äôs fine. The good affirmations are helping me feel better about myself and becomes better person. But you should really change those bad affirmations that I listed.

developerResponse: {'id': 36687550, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We‚Äôre always looking for ways to improve our app, so we really appreciate it. We‚Äôll pass this along to our development team!\n', 'modified': '2023-05-23T15:09:07Z'}
review: I would have rated this app 5 stars. Its limited unpaid version is decent and it is, for the most part, unobtrusive ad wise. However, two things. First, I get affirmations along the line of ‚ÄúMy body is in perfect health‚Äù and it‚Äôs quite difficult for that to be an affirmation with chronic illness. I‚Äôm sure other feel the same. Second,I‚Äôve noticed it being Mother‚Äôs Day, Father‚Äôs Day, etc unsure why but I did not anticipate seeing an affirmation that started with Happy Mothers Day. I realize this is the norm but for this to be a mental health app in some regard, I thought developers would be able to anticipate that some of these days may be a sore spot. This is not a bash. Perhaps you could reword the affirmations as ‚ÄúOn this Mothers Day‚Äù.. today is neither happy nor easy for many of us. If you do this for Father‚Äôs Day, perhaps think of rewording that that way as well. I‚Äôd love to see that change for those of us who struggle. Otherwise, I like what you‚Äôve done. Thank you.
title: Great app even with the limited free version, except‚Ä¶

review: I tried this app on free trial, thinking eventually I would delete it but I soon discovered how much I enjoy and appreciate this app. I sprained my ankle really bad and drove myself to the ER. After 5 hours of being there, I was exhausted and in pain. I had no idea how I was going to pay the bill and was worried about missing time off work. When I got in the car and looked at my phone it showed 2:22 and underneath the time was a notification from this app that read ‚Äúeverything will be okay‚Äù. I broke down in tears because I knew it was a message from the angels. This app has quickly become my favorite! I look forward to seeing what  notification will pop up throughout my day.  I don‚Äôt know how I lived without it! lol. To the developers: Thank you for making such a beautiful app that is both aesthetically and spiritually appealing! I will recommend this app to everyone I know!
title: Sent me a message when I needed it the most

developerResponse: {'id': 34664380, 'body': 'Thank you so much for letting us know how much you like our app! It means a lot and we really appreciate it.\n', 'modified': '2023-02-03T17:36:50Z'}
review: I have truly enjoyed this app. I found that I needed something like this in my life. I only have the free version, but it allows me to set how many messages/ affirmations I receive throughout the day. Having struggled with my health over the last few years and having two children with disabilities, this app gives me a break throughout the day to stop for a minute and reflect positively on myself and my life. Regardless of your faith, the messages you receive are inspiring and thought provoking. In today‚Äôs hectic life it is nice to be able to slow down, take a breath and read something inspiring and positive. I would highly recommend this app to anyone, even if you only set it to receive one message a day. It provides me with that little extra feel good each day.
title: My daily feel goods!

review:
After using this app and getting notifications from every app u made it makes me happy to get daily reminders of motivation. I wanted to add a idea for you. Within one of these apps adding a option to set a goal for yourself would be nice so u get daily motivation reminders to keep up with it and remember to not give up on it. For example, someone who wants to lose weight can add a picture of what they looked like a year ago and get daily motivation reminders to go to the gym or quotes or whatever it may be to keep them motivated. Another Example can be saving up for let's say a car a picture of the car and daily reminders to never give up on your goal of saving up for that car. 

I really hope this reaches the dev team and it gets read. I am sure many people who use this app may find this idea useful maybe even part of the dev team. 

Thank you!
title: Dear Dev Team of Monkey Taps

review:
To note, I have depression, anxiety and ADHD. This app as a widget on my phone can help change my thinking, ruminating, or negative thoughts without fail. The categories are perfection for individualizing but also the random helps to bring up new ideas you may not have thought of before. These tend to fit the exact circumstance you‚Äôre facing if needed. It helps to dig deeper within yourself and give yourself gratitude that can not only change your day but change your life. 
Of course the aesthetically please and non-glitchy app has backgrounds, fonts and ease in finding the affirmations extremely calming, inspiring despite it feeling so simple. It has changed my life, the way I am speaking or thinking of myself, and I do believe this App has true potential to rewire my brain and habits ‚Ä¶ not just each moment. But for a lifetime if I can continue this type of thinking. 

Thanks!!!! ü§ç‚úåüèº
title: Love this app

review:
Downloaded this app to check it out and loved it. Paid for premium within like 5 minutes of getting it. Use it every day and it has made a huge positive impact on my life. Downloaded and paid for premium on each person in my house‚Äôs device as well. 

Then they started advertising in app. My problem, advertisements for other apps by this company have started popping into my feed. 1. This is something that you usually pay for the premium version to escape ads. 2. The very premise of the app and of affirmations is that what you see, and read (and then possibly say) effects you. Having ads for the developer‚Äôs other apps in the middle of an affirmation practice is wrong. 

I‚Äôll be watching to see if this sticks around. I preferred this affirmations app for its clean and simple style both in looks and in use and the quality of its content. I‚Äôve been using it several times a day and recommending to everyone. If updates remove the ads, I‚Äôll keep it. If not, I‚Äôll find another program and replace it on our devices.

review: First, I love this app. With that said, however, it‚Äôs had a few glitches. I was told there was no way to recover my data. So I went through the process of re-adding some of my affirmations. When I got my iPad last summer, I added more on there, because it‚Äôs easier to type there. However, there‚Äôs no sync feature so all the affirmations I added (over 500) on my iPad aren‚Äôt available on my iPhone! I‚Äôve sent several requests for this feature, but all I ever see in the updates is ‚Äònew affirmations and themes added‚Äô, which is fine for people who use those, but I consider device syncing to be a core feature. I am considering letting my subscription expire because this has been bothering me for way too long, and I keep getting ‚Äòwe‚Äôll work on it‚Äô or ‚Äòwe‚Äôll consider adding this in a future update‚Äô from customer support.

title: So helpful

developerResponse: {'id': 32017055, 'body': 'Wow! Thanks so much for sharing your positive experience with our app. We‚Äôre so glad you‚Äôre enjoying it! ', 'modified': '2022-09-14T13:16:31Z'}
review:
I rarely leave reviews.  I use tons of apps and like many apps but just don‚Äôt leave reviews.  So why leave this review?  This app is helping me so much, that I felt a bit guilty staying quiet about how healing, powerful, and transformative it is.

This is a simple concept, brilliantly executed.  You receive affirmations pushed to your device.  You get to decide what topics you want to focus on, and there were way more topics than I imagined.  Truly something for everyone!  You also decide how often you receive the affirmations and can design widgets and watch faces as well - all customizable with many lovely backgrounds and fonts. 

Most important though are the affirmations and their health benefits.  Some of the things we struggle with require a major mind shift.  Getting positive reminders throughout the day helps shift negative patterns and helps build new mental habits.  

This app is helping me deal with anxiety, body image, self-care, and stress.  Throughout the day I feel like I have more support on my healing journey because of this app.  

I can‚Äôt thank the developers enough for creating an app that genuinely brings more good into this world - by enabling the good within each of us to emerge with greater power and presence.  Thank you so very much.
title: A fantastic app!

developerResponse: {'id': 20357543, 'body': 'We are so happy that you are enjoying the app. Thank you so much for your feedback!\n', 'modified': '2021-01-12T22:38:49Z'}
review:
Let me preface by saying I never write reviews, or if I have, I‚Äôve already forgotten about those apps. This app deserves one.

I‚Äôve had anxiety like symptoms for a while and only recently have I been seeing a therapist, which helps somewhat but it‚Äôs hard to remind yourself to change your way of thinking when the anxious feelings hit in the moment.

This app has helped me so much. I set my number of reminders to 10 so I do get affirmations often which some may find annoying (but it‚Äôs a setting that can be changed). Quite a few times however, they‚Äôve popped up right when I get triggered and help calm me down. Honestly would 10/10 recommend this to anyone with anxiety who needs help with more positive affirmations. I even told my therapist about it so she can share this!

developerResponse: {'id': 19602002, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for your suggestion, we will work on removing the negative connotation from the affirmations.', 'modified': '2020-12-07T22:06:45Z'}
review: I enjoy receiving the affirmations throughout the day. The only suggestion I would have is that the wording of some of the affirmations are negative in nature and can be improved ... such as ‚ÄúAnxiety will not beat me‚Äù (forgive me if that‚Äôs not the exact phrase, but you get the point) could be reworded more powerful such as ‚ÄúI am victorious over anxiety‚Äù. Early on in my journey with anxiety, I was told to use all positive words whenever possible and avoid using ‚Äúnot‚Äù ‚Äúdon‚Äôt‚Äù etc ... because your brain really processes the negative words so much faster than it does the positive words - it will have already processed ‚Äúanxiety beat me‚Äù before the brain can put together that what you really want processed is ‚Äúvictory over anxiety‚Äù.  Hope that makes sense!! Most of the affirmations in this app (I am using the free version) are good. Whenever I get one of those more negative-bent ones, I cringe a little.
title: Good, but could be great.

review:
This inexpensive app has been a pleasant surprise.  I thought I would use and see what was there, but my expectations weren‚Äôt high.  As it turns out, I was very impressed.  
The app lets you select a topic that you want help with (e.g.: motivation, personal growth, body image, relationships, etc.) and then allows you to choose to receive multiple one or two sentence support messages between the hours that you designate (e.g.: I would like to receive three messages per hour between 10am and 6pm).  You can save ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù and easily text or email a message you like to a friend or family member.
The messages ARE very uplifting and cover a range of emotions related to the subject you select.  All in all, it is a terrific app and I find myself looking forward to my next message.

review: I saw an ad for this app and actually thought it would be really cool and helpful to have, imagining i'd look at my phone and every once in awhile i'd see a little note that gives positive remarks to me, lifting my spirits. It seems like the perfect app for people who are unhappy, however, there is one little problem. When you walk through the steps of setting up what your name is, what things you want to improve on, the user is then met with the final step... "oh yeah, you only have three days to use this for free, and then you have to pay". If this isn't the biggest slap in the face to people that are struggling, then I don't know what is. To the devs of this app, you are cruel. You are marketing people's sadness and making money off of us, and it is nothing short of disgusting. Humans are deserving of happiness without cost of anything, this app needs to be completely free, no strings attached. I knew this was too good to be true.
title: Too good to be true.

title: An amazing product

review: I‚Äôm a fairly skeptical person however, I decided to give the app a chance.  The cost wasn‚Äôt a concern but I don‚Äôt normally believe these types of things work, especially on me.  After configuring the areas that were important for me, I let the I Am app do its thing.  After a while a noticed a difference in my mood.  The simple act of saying the notification out loud to myself and the persistent reminders, I realized I was wrong.  Engaging my voice was the key difference in convincing myself and feeling better.  Not just saying the things in my head but out loud. For the cost of a few coffee drinks you can make a positive difference in your mental health.
title: Skeptical but satisfied

review:
As an individual trying to change my thoughts and learn to self validate, this app is really helpful. The reason I cannot leave a 5 star review is simply because I have experience with DBT (dialectical behavioral therapy) and some of these affirmations could dialectically be better. 

For example: ‚ÄúI am a work in progress, but I am proud of what I have become so far.‚Äù In DBT we learn to say AND instead of BUT. That is because when using BUT you take away from the whole saying and it‚Äôs not acknowledging that being a work in progress is in itself a success. It‚Äôs like saying, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying BUT I‚Äôm not good enough yet.‚Äù

It feels more encouraging to say, ‚ÄúI am a work in progress AND I am proud of what I have become.‚Äù It feels more powerful saying it wholly.

review:
I used to scoff at the idea of affirmations. How cringe, right? Telling yourself you can do ~*anything*~ when you know your depression has had you bedridden for days. Yeah, not for me. 
Most affirmations I read before I am were so sickly sweet they bordered on delusional. Not true with this app. I am offers affirmations that are realistic, and that don‚Äôt dismiss the fact that life can be crummy sometimes. If you don‚Äôt like an affirmation, you can scroll to the next. If you do like it, you can save it. You don‚Äôt need premium access to benefit from the app. It even has a Home Screen widget! All in all it‚Äôs a great app, whether you‚Äôre an affirmations skeptic or devotee.

title: Positive Vibes

review:
I like this app but the main thing I don‚Äôt like is that we can make a ‚Äúcollection‚Äù so we can add all our top affirmations and title it (for instance, I made one for inner beauty). However, our collection does not become a category, meaning we can‚Äôt sift through our collection exclusively. We can use the ‚Äúdaily practice‚Äù feature on our collections, but that requires you to stick with an affirmation for at least one minute.

The only way we can sift through the affirmations in our collection is through the edit collection section, but it doesn‚Äôt feel as good cause then it‚Äôs basically a list. I can achieve the same thing by writing out my affirmations on my notes app.

Another thing is it would be nice if we could delete an affirmation when we‚Äôre going through the ones we created ourselves. Or at least when we‚Äôre editing ‚Äúmy affirmations‚Äù, have a search bar at the top so we don‚Äôt have to scroll and look for the affirmation we want to delete.

Hope that makes sense! Otherwise I really do like everything else
title: Great app but a few things can improve

I‚Äôm on the better side of things and currently out of treatment- but the mental damage of the diagnosis will never ever go away. This app has been EXACTLY what I need everyday. review:
As a subscribing customer, I loved this app. As someone who needed to downgrade to the free version for budgetary reasons, I‚Äôm ready to delete it and never use the app again. While I understand that displaying ads is necessary for revenue, I believe an app such as this should curate the ads that they are showing. It is completely inappropriate and off-brand for an affirmations app to be pushing disordered eating through diet ads. 

Love ourselves the way we are, but subscribe to these diet services so we can love ourselves more? Clearly this app isn‚Äôt here to improve my mental health, it‚Äôs here to make money for the developers while they pretend to empower others.

TL: DR; this app promotes toxic thinking through ads and should be avoided because it‚Äôs modern snake oil salesman.

review: One of the first things I do with my therapy clients, shortly after covering things like confidentiality and exceptions when there is danger to self/others, etc... is to have them put two things on their phones: 1) Their lists of crisis contacts amd 2) Your ‚ÄúI Am‚Äù app. I have seen it help reduce the effects on self-image caused by PTSD, abuse, abandonment, and neglect. Of course nothing replaces learning how to build personal-relationships and finding the courage to risk trusting again, but this app helps them take that risk.

It would be nice to be able to flag or block the triggering affirmations so they don‚Äôt show up anymore. I emailed support, and they said they‚Äôd consider it. title: Great app but...

review:
It was disappointing to see the new ‚ÄúFor Women‚Äù and ‚ÄúFor Men‚Äù categories. Like, don‚Äôt the other categories cover the needs of all humans? Why gender it? And then, if you actually read the affirmations for women compared to the ones for men, it‚Äôs...pretty bad. 

For women, you get things like, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a great listener‚Äù and ‚ÄúNot everyone will like me and that‚Äôs ok‚Äù and ‚Äú I take good care of my family and people who I love‚Äù which are great for everyone, but for men you get things like ‚ÄúI‚Äôm indestructible‚Äù and ‚ÄúI have unlimited power‚Äù and ‚ÄúI am a gift to the world‚Äù? 

I get that you want people to have confidence, but why are the weirdly chest-thumping versions ‚ÄúFor Men‚Äù? Why aren‚Äôt the more empathetic affirmations in their category as well?

developerResponse: {'id': 25933577, 'body': 'We make user experience and satisfaction as our priority, and your review reaffirms the hard work we put in every day. Thanks for sharing your feedback with us and the community.', 'modified': '2021-10-27T18:23:47Z'}
review:
This app moves me to tears sometimes. It is so important that we love ourselves. Sometimes depending on on experiences or our environments is hard to know exactly how to go about doing that a way that is constructive and effective.

review:
EVERYONE NEEDS TO LISTEN:
this app deserves negative a trillion stars because it is the most pointless apps ever and that you will ever come across in you whole life. You will never find an app worse than this. LET ME EXPLAIN:

The app tries to tell you great and amazing things about yourself without actually knowing who you are or what you‚Äôve done and what situation you‚Äôre in. I don‚Äôt need this kind of goofy nonsensical stuff in my head every time I pick up my goddarn phone. I don't deserve any of the garbage on here. Before you go ahead and judge me, I will say that people have been telling me good, positive, things ever since I was little and there‚Äôs always a truckload more negative stuff than positive stuff in this life. With that said, you don‚Äôt need this app on your phone to try to make you feel better, especially if you have depression. You‚Äôre better off staying depressed, then downloading whatever this thing is. 

Thanks for your time, and I strongly hope you will listen to me on this.

review: The app itself does send you affirmations which you can customize to your preference like gratitude, confidence, etc. The issue is the app can only send I believe 60 affirmations a week. which may sound like a lot, but the problem is instead of spreading the affirmations out over the span of the week they may send them all over a 2 day period and you wont have it for the rest of the week, or just as likely even a few weeks because often the app does not reset properly. Overall the app is ok but with some bug fixes has potential to become great.

title: I AM APP

review: Many small complaints add up. Firstly, the font is atrocious. Notification and general settings can seem impenetrable, though maybe it‚Äôs the design. The phrase bank is polluted with low quality affirmations. There are too many themes you can‚Äôt filter out for free. I quickly found myself putting affirmations into two categories: self-respecting and self-aggrandizing. This ended up pulling me toward and away from my goal. Bottom line is that less content would be better but then you‚Äôd have no reason to upgrade other than getting rid of ads.

review:
i‚Äôve had this app for about a year and am blown away by how much it‚Äôs helped me. as a woman living with bipolar schizoaffecfive disorder, it can be extremely difficult for me to think positively: not only toward myself but toward life in general.

in the morning, middle of the afternoon and before i go to sleep i scroll through this app for a few minutes, reading each affirming quote and repeating to myself. it makes me smile, feel lighter, and love myself a little more each time.

on days when i cannot muster any self love or encouragement, this app is there to help me through and i truly cannot thank its creators enough. the beautiful, soothing backgrounds and the large, accessible text are also so appreciated. thank you!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 19097249, 'body': "Hi there, we don't have a way to listen to your conversations and is also technically impossible. Our app has a recommendation system that every time you like an affirmation it tries to send you very similar affirmations that adapt to your mood. Everything else is just pure coincidence.", 'modified': '2020-11-13T18:39:47Z'}
review:
I have really enjoyed using this application so far. However, the affirmations that appear randomly are incredibly accurate and relatable to my current life situations that I believe this app is listening to me.

It‚Äôs remarkable to see a notification appear after I say certain keywords.

For instance, I had discussed that I no longer was interested in finishing my fast food meal because I wanted purse a healthier diet. 3 minutes later I received the affirmation, ‚ÄúI am in control of my eating habits‚Äù.

Several hours later, I had a conversation about choosing to return to a vegan diet because I liked how healthy I used to feel and not shortly after I received the affirmation, ‚ÄúI am moving towards better health‚Äù.

These random occurrences happen daily and over 6 times. When do we classify these coincidences as intentional?
title: This is App Is Listening

title: I want to view only my own affirmations

review:
Switch and bait. 

I downloaded the "I am - daily affirmations" app with high hopes, but unfortunately, my experience has been quite disappointing. The app initially appeared to offer positive daily affirmations for free, which was appealing. However, after a short period of use, I was prompted to pay for what I believed would be included content.

The sudden push for payment was unexpected and left a sour taste in my mouth. I value transparency when it comes to app subscriptions, and this app seemed to lack it. While the affirmations themselves were uplifting, the subscription model and payment demands overshadowed the positive aspects of the app.

I hope the developers can reconsider their approach to monetization and provide users with clearer information upfront. Until then, I'll be exploring other apps that offer daily affirmations without hidden charges.
title: Disappointing Experience

title: I am

review:
This app is really powerful. A lot of positive phrases to repeat to yourself when you are at a lack of words. You are not limited to one a day and the UI is very pleasing. 

However, the idea of paying for some of these phrases are ridiculous to me because of the vast amount of grammatical errors present. 

A lot are written with words missing and its really distracting trying to focus on the message. Which is specifically why this is a 4/5

As far as I know, you cannot edit these sayings. However, you can downvote ones that do not resonate with you which I really enjoy as a feature. For me that would mean I unnecessarily would miss out on good sayings because of how badly some are written

I love this app and use it daily. 

Fav features: customizing notifications (I get 5 daily), widget for Home Screen, cute wallpaper/backdrop options, favoriting, and customizing which kind of affirmations I see. 

Cons: I am not a fan of that fact that so many are written in the future tense! This part is much more important than all those features above, in my opinion. For the most potency, I prefer affirmations stated in present or past tense. ie: instead of ‚ÄúI will shine my light brightly‚Äù it would be ‚ÄúI shine my light brightly‚Äù. 

Would rate 5 stars if not for this!
